imgDesc.text: Lesser Lord Kusanali and Greater Lord Rukkhadevata

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.text: , Buer became the new Dendro Archon of Sumeru.

customize.name: Rukkhadevata
customize.desc: The Goddess of Wisdom, the previous Dendro Archon, and a friend of Nabu Malikata and King Deshret. She was completely erased from Irminsul to save it from forbidden knowledge.

customize.text: When the previous Dendro Archon, Greater Lord Rukkhadevata, was corrupted by the forbidden knowledge, she created Buer from the purest branch of

customize.name: Irminsul
customize.desc: Irminsul can be thought of as a large tree growing downwards rather than upwards, containing all the knowledge and wisdom of the world from ancient times to the present. Ley Lines, like the roots of Irminsul, cross the earth, absorbing the memories of the world.

customize.text: . Later, Lesser Lord Kusanali erased her creator from Irminsul entirely to eliminate the forbidden knowledge.

customize.name: Sumeru Akademiya
customize.desc: The Sumeru organization, which exercises administrative control over the region and educates people.

customize.text: The sages from the Akademiya found newborn Buer after Rukkadevata died. They considered the new Archon too weak and still worshipped the Greater Lord, so they locked Buer in the Sanctuary of Surasthana and started ruling Sumeru themselves.

customize.name: Sabzeruz Festival
customize.desc: A Sumeru festival named after the Goddess of Flowers and celebrating the birthday of the Dendro Archon.

customize.text: A Sumeru festival named after the Goddess of Flowers and celebrating the birthday of the Dendro Archon, a day when the sages found Buer. For a long time, the Akademiya had forbidden the celebration, but after they were overthrown, the festival has been celebrated again.

customize.name: Aranara
customize.desc: Greater Lord Rukkhadevata's familiars and spirits of the forest.

customize.name: Pari
customize.desc: The Dendro Archon's familiars. They were born from the pure Amrita and the divine bird, Simurgh.

customize.name: Scaramouche
customize.desc: The former sixth of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, created by Raiden Ei.

customize.text: Scaramouche wanted to become the new mechanical Archon but was stopped by Buer.

customize.name: Traveler
customize.desc: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.

customize.name: Il Dottore
customize.desc: The Second of the Eleven Fatui Harbingers, codenamed The Doctor. Had multiple "segments" of himself, nearly all of which he destroyed in a deal with the Dendro Archon.

customize.text: A Fatui Harbinger exchanged the Electro and Dendro

customize.name: Gnosis
customize.desc: Gnoses are internal magical foci that each of The Seven possesses, allowing them to resonate directly with Celestia itself and serving as an emblem of their status. The Gnoses were created from the remains of the Third Descender.

customize.text: for the elimination of his segments and information about the fake sky.

The Dendro Sovereign of Sumeru. When Buer eliminated the forbidden knowledge, a part of corrupted Apep was destroyed as well. With the help of the creatures who lived inside Apep, Buer cured the Dendro Dragon.

customize.name: Silver Twig
customize.desc:
A new branch taken from the center of the world.

There was once a giant tree that ran across the world, and this twig was part of it. Though it has been removed from the tree, their connection remains strong as ever.

Therefore, as long as the giant white tree that symbolizes the center of the world does not die, it will never wither.

"Trees" symbolize life. In one of the stories from a certain place, there was a person who had entrusted her consciousness to the white tree's branches before she passed away. In that way, neither her life nor hope would be lost, since the branches would grow and sprout where there was sunshine and rain, and would one day blossom and bear fruits.

"Trees" also symbolize wisdom. In one of the legends, a sage hanging upside down on a tree had acquired the knowledge of how to inscribe runes and control sacred words, and thus followed the kingdom established along the tree's roots, eventually gaining a glimpse of the secret of the cosmos.

All knowledge, memory, and experience flow through this giant tree, just like a stream flows into a river, the river joins a sea, the sea turns into clouds, and the clouds rain onto the ground - just like life itself.

God of Wisdom

value.name: Nahida
value.desc: A caged bird secluded within the confines of the Sanctuary of Surasthana who can only see the world in her dreams.
